intro: Eriogonum rubidum, commonly known as the redstem buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its reddish stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and grasslands. It produces numerous tiny, pink to red flowers that bloom in the spring. Eriogonum rubidum is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
